intro: Duchesnea, commonly known as oxalis, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Oxalidaceae. It consists of about 200 species, many of which are native to the Americas. The plants typically have trifoliate leaves and produce small, yellow or orange flowers. They are often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodland floors and stream banks. Some species are cultivated as ornamental plants due to their attractive foliage and flowers.
